Key Arguments: The legislation undermines freedom of speech, which should be protected in a democracy.
The government is positioned as the arbiter of what constitutes misinformation, disinformation, and harm.
The restrictions on freedom of speech do not apply to the government itself.
The legislation gives the government power to regulate what it determines to be true, likening it to authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: It has no place in a real democracy where freedom of speech should be protected.
This is the type of legislation we saw in Stalinist Russia and has no place in a democracy.
